meanings.definition: A tree or shrub native to Australia.
meanings.sent1: The boree provided shade in the hot Australian sun.
meanings.sent2: The boree's leaves rustled in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent3: The koala napped under the boree, enjoying its cool shelter.
meanings.sent4: The boree stood tall like a guardian of the Outback.
meanings.sent5: The colorful parrots nested in the branches of the boree.

meanings.definition: A strong wind in the Australian Outback.
meanings.sent1: The boree howled through the desert, stirring up dust.
meanings.sent2: The boree swept across the plains, bending the grasses.
meanings.sent3: The boree played a wild tune on the didgeridoo of the Outback.
meanings.sent4: The boree's force could rival even the fiercest storm.
meanings.sent5: The boree carried the scent of eucalyptus across the land.

meanings.definition: To make a hole by drilling or digging.
meanings.sent1: He used a drill to boree a hole through the wood.
meanings.sent2: The miners boree deep into the earth in search of gold.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to boree a tunnel through the hard ground.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the tree boree into the soil for nutrients.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologists boree carefully to uncover ancient artifacts.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel bored or uninterested.
meanings.sent1: The long lecture began to boree the students.
meanings.sent2: The repetitive tasks started to boree him after a while.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes failed to boree the audience.
meanings.sent4: The lackluster performance boree no resemblance to their previous shows.
meanings.sent5: The monotonous tone of the speaker boree into their minds.
